distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for GraphicsMagick fixes the following issues: 

- CVE-2016-5118: popen() shell vulnerability via special filenames (bnc#982178).
- CVE-2013-4589: The ExportAlphaQuantumType function in export.c in GraphicsMagick might have allowed remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors related to exporting the alpha of an 8-bit RGBA image (bsc#851064).
- CVE-2015-8808: Out-of-bound read in the parsing of GIF files (bnc#965574).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: The DecodeImage function in coders/gif.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.18 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory access) via a crafted GIF file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The OpenBlob function in blob.c in GraphicsMagick before 1.3.24 and ImageMagick allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a | (pipe) character at the start of a filename.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
